socket_summary_by_event_name:
CREATE TABLE `socket_summary_by_event_name` (
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Socket instrument.',
  `COUNT_STAR` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of summarized events',
  `SUM_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `MIN_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Minimum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `AVG_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Average wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `MAX_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Maximum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `COUNT_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of all read operations, including RECV, RECVFROM, and RECVMSG.',
  `SUM_TIMER_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total wait time of all read operations that are timed.',
  `MIN_TIMER_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Minimum wait time of all read operations that are timed.',
  `AVG_TIMER_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Average wait time of all read operations that are timed.',
  `MAX_TIMER_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Maximum wait time of all read operations that are timed.',
  `SUM_NUMBER_OF_BYTES_READ` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Bytes read by read operations.',
  `COUNT_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of all write operations, including SEND, SENDTO, and SENDMSG.',
  `SUM_TIMER_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total wait time of all write operations that are timed.',
  `MIN_TIMER_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Minimum wait time of all write operations that are timed.',
  `AVG_TIMER_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Average wait time of all write operations that are timed.',
  `MAX_TIMER_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Maximum wait time of all write operations that are timed.',
  `SUM_NUMBER_OF_BYTES_WRITE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Bytes written by write operations.',
  `COUNT_MISC` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of all miscellaneous operations not counted above, including CONNECT, LISTEN, ACCEPT, CLOSE, and SHUTDOWN.',
  `SUM_TIMER_MISC` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total wait time of all miscellaneous operations that are timed.',
  `MIN_TIMER_MISC` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Minimum wait time of all miscellaneous operations that are timed.',
  `AVG_TIMER_MISC` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Average wait time of all miscellaneous operations that are timed.',
  `MAX_TIMER_MISC` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Maximum wait time of all miscellaneous operations that are timed.'
) ;
events_waits_summary_by_instance:

  `SUM_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `MIN_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Minimum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `AVG_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Average wait time of the summarized events that are timed.',
  `MAX_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Maximum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.'
) ;
events_stages_history_long:
CREATE TABLE `events_stages_history_long` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread associated with the event. Together with EVENT_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread''s current event number at the start of the event. Together with THREAD_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL when the event starts, set to the thread''s current event number at the end of the event.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing started or NULL if timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing ended, or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds of the event''s duration or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `WORK_COMPLETED` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of work units completed for the stage. NULL if the stage event progress is not instrumented.',
  `WORK_ESTIMATED` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of work units expected for the stage. NULL if the stage event progress is not instrumented.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'EVENT_ID of event within which this event nests.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Nesting event type. Either transaction, statement, stage or wait.'
) ;

events_statements_summary_by_program:
CREATE TABLE `events_statements_summary_by_program` (
  `OBJECT_TYPE` enum('EVENT','FUNCTION','PROCEDURE','TABLE','TRIGGER') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Object type for which the summary is generated.',
  `OBJECT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) NOT NULL -- 'The schema of the object for which the summary is generated.',
  `OBJECT_NAME` varchar(64) NOT NULL -- 'The name of the object for which the summary is generated.',
  `COUNT_STAR` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The number of summarized events (from events_statements_current). This value includes all events, whether timed or nontimed.',
  `SUM_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total wait time of the summarized timed events. This value is calculated only for timed events because nontimed events have a wait time of NULL. The same is true for the other xxx_TIMER_WAIT values.',
  `MIN_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The minimum wait time of the summarized timed events.',
  `AVG_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The average wait time of the summarized timed events.',
  `MAX_TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The maximum wait time of the summarized timed events.',
  `COUNT_STATEMENTS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Total number of nested statements invoked during stored program execution.',
  `SUM_STATEMENTS_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total wait time of the summarized timed statements. This value is calculated only for timed statements because nontimed statements have a wait time of NULL. The same is true for the other xxx_STATEMENT_WAIT values.',
  `MIN_STATEMENTS_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The minimum wait time of the summarized timed statements.',
  `AVG_STATEMENTS_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The average wait time of the summarized timed statements.',
  `MAX_STATEMENTS_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The maximum wait time of the summarized timed statements.',
  `SUM_LOCK_TIME` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total time spent (in picoseconds) waiting for table locks for the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_ERRORS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of errors that occurend for the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_WARNINGS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of warnings that occurend for the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_ROWS_AFFECTED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of affected rows by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_ROWS_SENT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of rows returned by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_ROWS_EXAMINED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of rows examined by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_CREATED_TMP_DISK_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of on-disk temporary tables created by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_CREATED_TMP_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of in-memory temporary tables created by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SELECT_FULL_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of full joins executed by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SELECT_FULL_RANGE_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of range search joins executed by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SELECT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of joins that used ranges on the first table executed by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SELECT_RANGE_CHECK` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of joins that check for key usage after each row executed by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SELECT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of joins that did a full scan of the first table executed by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SORT_MERGE_PASSES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do for the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SORT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of sorts that were done using ranges for the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SORT_ROWS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of sorted rows that were sorted by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_SORT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of sorts that were done by scanning the table by the summarized statements.',
  `SUM_NO_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of statements that performed a table scan without using an index.',
  `SUM_NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The total number of statements where no good index was found.'
) ;
events_statements_history:
CREATE TABLE `events_statements_history` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread associated with the event. Together with EVENT_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread''s current event number at the start of the event. Together with THREAD_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL when the event starts, set to the thread''s current event number at the end of the event.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing started or NULL if timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing ended, or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds of the event''s duration or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `LOCK_TIME` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Time in picoseconds spent waiting for locks. The time is calculated in microseconds but stored in picoseconds for compatibility with other timings.',
  `SQL_TEXT` longtext DEFAULT NULL -- 'The SQL statement, or NULL if the command is not associated with an SQL statement.',
  `DIGEST` varchar(32) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement digest.',
  `DIGEST_TEXT` longtext DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement digest text.',
  `CURRENT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement''s default database for the statement, or NULL if there was none.',
  `OBJECT_TYPE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object type for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object schema for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_NAME` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object name for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Address in memory of the statement object.',
  `MYSQL_ERRNO` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Error code. See MariaDB Error Codes for a full list.',
  `RETURNED_SQLSTATE` varchar(5) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The SQLSTATE value.',
  `MESSAGE_TEXT` varchar(128) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement error message. See MariaDB Error Codes.',
  `ERRORS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if SQLSTATE signifies completion (starting with 00) or warning (01), otherwise 1.',
  `WARNINGS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of warnings from the diagnostics area.',
  `ROWS_AFFECTED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows affected the statement affected.',
  `ROWS_SENT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows returned.',
  `ROWS_EXAMINED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows read during the statement''s execution.',
  `CREATED_TMP_DISK_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of on-disk temp tables created by the statement.',
  `CREATED_TMP_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of temp tables created by the statement.',
  `SELECT_FULL_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which did not use an index.',
  `SELECT_FULL_RANGE_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range search of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE_CHECK` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins without keys performed by the statement that check for key usage after each row.',
  `SELECT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a full scan of the first table.',
  `SORT_MERGE_PASSES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of merge passes by the sort algorithm performed by the statement. If too high, you may need to increase the sort_buffer_size.',
  `SORT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a range.',
  `SORT_ROWS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows sorted by the statement.',
  `SORT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a full table scan.',
  `NO_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if the statement performed a table scan with an index, 1 if without an index.',
  `NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if a good index was found for the statement, 1 if no good index was found. See the Range checked for each record description in the EXPLAIN article.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event id for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event type for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_LEVEL` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- '0 for top level statements. The parent statement level plus 1 for nested statements (stored programs).'
) ;

events_transactions_history:
CREATE TABLE `events_transactions_history` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The thread associated with the event.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The event id associated with the event.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'This column is set to NULL when the event starts and updated to the thread current event number when the event ends.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'The name of the instrument from which the event was collected. This is a NAME value from the setup_instruments table.',
  `STATE` enum('ACTIVE','COMMITTED','ROLLED BACK') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The current transaction state. The value is ACTIVE (after START TRANSACTION or BEGIN), COMMITTED (after COMMIT), or ROLLED BACK (after ROLLBACK).',
  `TRX_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `GTID` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction GTID, using the format DOMAIN-SERVER_ID-SEQUENCE_NO.',
  `XID_FORMAT_ID` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction format ID for GTRID and BQUAL values.',
  `XID_GTRID` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA global transaction ID.',
  `XID_BQUAL` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction branch qualifier.',
  `XA_STATE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The state of the XA transaction. The value is ACTIVE (after XA START), IDLE (after XA END), PREPARED (after XA PREPARE), ROLLED BACK (after XA ROLLBACK), or COMMITTED (after XA COMMIT).',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The name of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event and the line number in the file at which the instrumentation occurs.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing started. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing ended. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. Event duration. NULL if event has not timing information.',
  `ACCESS_MODE` enum('READ ONLY','READ WRITE') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction access mode.',
  `ISOLATION_LEVEL` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction isolation level. One of: REPEATABLE READ, READ COMMITTED, READ UNCOMMITTED, or SERIALIZABLE.',
  `AUTOCOMMIT` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'Whether autcommit mode was enabled when the transaction started.',
  `NUMBER_OF_SAVEPOINTS` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_RELEASE_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of RELEASE_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The EVENT_ID value of the event within which this event is nested.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The nesting event type.'
) ;

) ;

threads:
CREATE TABLE `threads` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'A unique thread identifier.',
  `NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Name associated with the server''s thread instrumentation code, for example thread/sql/main for the server''s main() function, and thread/sql/one_connection for a user connection.',
  `TYPE` varchar(10) NOT NULL -- 'FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND, depending on the thread type. User connection threads are FOREGROUND, internal server threads are BACKGROUND.',
  `PROCESSLIST_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.',
  `PROCESSLIST_USER` varchar(128) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Foreground thread user, or NULL for a background thread.',
  `PROCESSLIST_HOST` varchar(255) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Foreground thread host, or NULL for a background thread.',
  `PROCESSLIST_DB` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Thread''s default database, or NULL if none exists.',
  `PROCESSLIST_COMMAND` varchar(16) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Type of command executed by the thread. These correspond to the the COM_xxx client/server protocol commands, and the Com_xxx status variables. See Thread Command Values.',
  `PROCESSLIST_TIME` bigint(20) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.',
  `PROCESSLIST_STATE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Action, event or state indicating what the thread is doing.',
  `PROCESSLIST_INFO` longtext DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement being executed by the thread, or NULL if a statement is not being executed. If a statement results in calling other statements, such as for a stored procedure, the innermost statement from the stored procedure is shown here.',
  `PARENT_THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'THREAD_ID of the parent thread, if any. Subthreads can for example be spawned as a result of INSERT DELAYED statements.',
  `ROLE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `INSTRUMENTED` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'YES or NO for Whether the thread is instrumented or not. For foreground threads, the initial value is determined by whether there''s a user/host match in the setup_actors table. Subthreads are again matched, while for background threads, this will be set to YES by default. To monitor events that the thread executes, INSTRUMENTED must be YES and the thread_instrumentation consumer in the setup_consumers table must also be YES.',
  `HISTORY` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'Whether to log historical events for the thread.',
  `CONNECTION_TYPE` varchar(16) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The protocol used to establish the connection, or NULL for background threads.',
  `THREAD_OS_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The thread or task identifier as defined by the underlying operating system, if there is one.'
) ;

host_cache:
CREATE TABLE `host_cache` (
  `IP` varchar(64) NOT NULL -- 'Client IP address.',
  `HOST` varchar(255)  DEFAULT NULL -- 'IP''s resolved DNS host name, or NULL if unknown.',
  `HOST_VALIDATED` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'YES if the IP-to-host DNS lookup was successful, and the HOST column can be used to avoid DNS calls, or NO if unsuccessful, in which case DNS lookup is performed for each connect until either successful or a permanent error.',
  `SUM_CONNECT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of connection errors. Counts only protocol handshake errors for hosts that passed validation. These errors count towards max_connect_errors.',
  `COUNT_HOST_BLOCKED_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of blocked connections because SUM_CONNECT_ERRORS exceeded the max_connect_errors system variable.',
  `COUNT_NAMEINFO_TRANSIENT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of transient errors during IP-to-host DNS lookups.',
  `COUNT_NAMEINFO_PERMANENT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of permanent errors during IP-to-host DNS lookups.',
  `COUNT_FORMAT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of host name format errors, for example a numeric host column.',
  `COUNT_ADDRINFO_TRANSIENT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of transient errors during host-to-IP reverse DNS lookups.',
  `COUNT_ADDRINFO_PERMANENT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of permanent errors during host-to-IP reverse DNS lookups.',
  `COUNT_FCRDNS_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of forward-confirmed reverse DNS errors, which occur when IP-to-host DNS lookup does not match the originating IP address.',
  `COUNT_HOST_ACL_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors occurring because no user from the host is permitted to log in. These attempts return error code 1130 ER_HOST_NOT_PRIVILEGED and do not proceed to username and password authentication.',
  `COUNT_NO_AUTH_PLUGIN_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to requesting an authentication plugin that was not available. This can be due to the plugin never having been loaded, or the load attempt failing.',
  `COUNT_AUTH_PLUGIN_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors reported by an authentication plugin. Plugins can increment COUNT_AUTHENTICATION_ERRORS or COUNT_HANDSHAKE_ERRORS instead, but, if specified or the error is unknown, this column is incremented.',
  `COUNT_HANDSHAKE_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors detected at the wire protocol level.',
  `COUNT_PROXY_USER_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors detected when a proxy user is proxied to a user that does not exist.',
  `COUNT_PROXY_USER_ACL_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors detected when a proxy user is proxied to a user that exists, but the proxy user doesn''t have the PROXY privilege.',
  `COUNT_AUTHENTICATION_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors where authentication failed.',
  `COUNT_SSL_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to TLS problems.',
  `COUNT_MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to the per-user quota being exceeded.',
  `COUNT_MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to the per-hour quota being exceeded.',
  `COUNT_DEFAULT_DATABASE_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to the user not having permission to access the specified default database, or it not existing.',
  `COUNT_INIT_CONNECT_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of errors due to statements in the init_connect system variable.',
  `COUNT_LOCAL_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of local server errors, such as out-of-memory errors, unrelated to network, authentication, or authorization.',
  `COUNT_UNKNOWN_ERRORS` bigint(20) NOT NULL -- 'Number of unknown errors that cannot be allocated to another column.',
  `FIRST_SEEN` timestamp NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00' -- 'Timestamp of the first connection attempt by the IP.',
  `LAST_SEEN` timestamp NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00' -- 'Timestamp of the most recent connection attempt by the IP.',
  `FIRST_ERROR_SEEN` timestamp NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00' -- 'Timestamp of the first error seen from the IP.',
  `LAST_ERROR_SEEN` timestamp NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00' -- 'Timestamp of the most recent error seen from the IP.'
) ;

events_transactions_history_long:
CREATE TABLE `events_transactions_history_long` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The thread associated with the event.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The event id associated with the event.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'This column is set to NULL when the event starts and updated to the thread current event number when the event ends.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'The name of the instrument from which the event was collected. This is a NAME value from the setup_instruments table.',
  `STATE` enum('ACTIVE','COMMITTED','ROLLED BACK') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The current transaction state. The value is ACTIVE (after START TRANSACTION or BEGIN), COMMITTED (after COMMIT), or ROLLED BACK (after ROLLBACK).',
  `TRX_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `GTID` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction GTID, using the format DOMAIN-SERVER_ID-SEQUENCE_NO.',
  `XID_FORMAT_ID` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction format ID for GTRID and BQUAL values.',
  `XID_GTRID` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA global transaction ID.',
  `XID_BQUAL` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction branch qualifier.',
  `XA_STATE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The state of the XA transaction. The value is ACTIVE (after XA START), IDLE (after XA END), PREPARED (after XA PREPARE), ROLLED BACK (after XA ROLLBACK), or COMMITTED (after XA COMMIT).',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The name of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event and the line number in the file at which the instrumentation occurs.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing started. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing ended. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. Event duration. NULL if event has not timing information.',
  `ACCESS_MODE` enum('READ ONLY','READ WRITE') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction access mode.',
  `ISOLATION_LEVEL` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction isolation level. One of: REPEATABLE READ, READ COMMITTED, READ UNCOMMITTED, or SERIALIZABLE.',
  `AUTOCOMMIT` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'Whether autcommit mode was enabled when the transaction started.',
  `NUMBER_OF_SAVEPOINTS` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_RELEASE_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of RELEASE_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The EVENT_ID value of the event within which this event is nested.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The nesting event type.'
) ;

events_transactions_current:
CREATE TABLE `events_transactions_current` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The thread associated with the event.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'The event id associated with the event.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'This column is set to NULL when the event starts and updated to the thread current event number when the event ends.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'The name of the instrument from which the event was collected. This is a NAME value from the setup_instruments table.',
  `STATE` enum('ACTIVE','COMMITTED','ROLLED BACK') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The current transaction state. The value is ACTIVE (after START TRANSACTION or BEGIN), COMMITTED (after COMMIT), or ROLLED BACK (after ROLLBACK).',
  `TRX_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `GTID` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction GTID, using the format DOMAIN-SERVER_ID-SEQUENCE_NO.',
  `XID_FORMAT_ID` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction format ID for GTRID and BQUAL values.',
  `XID_GTRID` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA global transaction ID.',
  `XID_BQUAL` varchar(130) DEFAULT NULL -- 'XA transaction branch qualifier.',
  `XA_STATE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The state of the XA transaction. The value is ACTIVE (after XA START), IDLE (after XA END), PREPARED (after XA PREPARE), ROLLED BACK (after XA ROLLBACK), or COMMITTED (after XA COMMIT).',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The name of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event and the line number in the file at which the instrumentation occurs.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing started. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. When event timing ended. NULL if event has no timing information.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The unit is picoseconds. Event duration. NULL if event has not timing information.',
  `ACCESS_MODE` enum('READ ONLY','READ WRITE') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction access mode.',
  `ISOLATION_LEVEL` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Transaction isolation level. One of: REPEATABLE READ, READ COMMITTED, READ UNCOMMITTED, or SERIALIZABLE.',
  `AUTOCOMMIT` enum('YES','NO') NOT NULL -- 'Whether autcommit mode was enabled when the transaction started.',
  `NUMBER_OF_SAVEPOINTS` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `NUMBER_OF_RELEASE_SAVEPOINT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of RELEASE_SAVEPOINT statements issued during the transaction.',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Unused.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The EVENT_ID value of the event within which this event is nested.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'The nesting event type.'
) ;

  `OBJECT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object schema for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_NAME` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object name for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Address in memory of the statement object.',

  `CREATED_TMP_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of temp tables created by the statement.',
  `SELECT_FULL_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which did not use an index.',
  `SELECT_FULL_RANGE_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range search of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE_CHECK` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins without keys performed by the statement that check for key usage after each row.',
  `SELECT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a full scan of the first table.',
  `SORT_MERGE_PASSES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of merge passes by the sort algorithm performed by the statement. If too high, you may need to increase the sort_buffer_size.',
  `SORT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a range.',
  `SORT_ROWS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows sorted by the statement.',
  `SORT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a full table scan.',
  `NO_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if the statement performed a table scan with an index, 1 if without an index.',
  `NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if a good index was found for the statement, 1 if no good index was found. See the Range checked for each record description in the EXPLAIN article.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event id for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event type for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_LEVEL` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- '0 for top level statements. The parent statement level plus 1 for nested statements (stored programs).'
) ;

events_statements_current:
CREATE TABLE `events_statements_current` (
  `THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread associated with the event. Together with EVENT_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Thread''s current event number at the start of the event. Together with THREAD_ID uniquely identifies the row.',
  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL when the event starts, set to the thread''s current event number at the end of the event.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing started or NULL if timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing ended, or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds of the event''s duration or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `LOCK_TIME` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Time in picoseconds spent waiting for locks. The time is calculated in microseconds but stored in picoseconds for compatibility with other timings.',
  `SQL_TEXT` longtext DEFAULT NULL -- 'The SQL statement, or NULL if the command is not associated with an SQL statement.',
  `DIGEST` varchar(32) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement digest.',
  `DIGEST_TEXT` longtext DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement digest text.',
  `CURRENT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement''s default database for the statement, or NULL if there was none.',
  `OBJECT_TYPE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object type for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_SCHEMA` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object schema for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_NAME` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement object name for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Address in memory of the statement object.',
  `MYSQL_ERRNO` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Error code. See MariaDB Error Codes for a full list.',
  `RETURNED_SQLSTATE` varchar(5) DEFAULT NULL -- 'The SQLSTATE value.',
  `MESSAGE_TEXT` varchar(128) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Statement error message. See MariaDB Error Codes.',
  `ERRORS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if SQLSTATE signifies completion (starting with 00) or warning (01), otherwise 1.',
  `WARNINGS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of warnings from the diagnostics area.',
  `ROWS_AFFECTED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows affected the statement affected.',
  `ROWS_SENT` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows returned.',
  `ROWS_EXAMINED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows read during the statement''s execution.',
  `CREATED_TMP_DISK_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of on-disk temp tables created by the statement.',
  `CREATED_TMP_TABLES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of temp tables created by the statement.',
  `SELECT_FULL_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which did not use an index.',
  `SELECT_FULL_RANGE_JOIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range search of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a range of the first table.',
  `SELECT_RANGE_CHECK` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins without keys performed by the statement that check for key usage after each row.',
  `SELECT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of joins performed by the statement which used a full scan of the first table.',
  `SORT_MERGE_PASSES` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of merge passes by the sort algorithm performed by the statement. If too high, you may need to increase the sort_buffer_size.',
  `SORT_RANGE` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a range.',
  `SORT_ROWS` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of rows sorted by the statement.',
  `SORT_SCAN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Number of sorts performed by the statement which used a full table scan.',
  `NO_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if the statement performed a table scan with an index, 1 if without an index.',
  `NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- '0 if a good index was found for the statement, 1 if no good index was found. See the Range checked for each record description in the EXPLAIN article.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event id for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL for top level statements. The parent statement event type for nested statements (stored programs).',
  `NESTING_EVENT_LEVEL` int(11) DEFAULT NULL -- '0 for top level statements. The parent statement level plus 1 for nested statements (stored programs).'
) ;

metadata_locks:
CREATE TABLE `metadata_locks` (
  `OBJECT_TYPE` varchar(64) NOT NULL -- 'Object type. One of BACKUP, COMMIT, EVENT, FUNCTION, GLOBAL, LOCKING SERVICE, PROCEDURE, SCHEMA, TABLE, TABLESPACE, TRIGGER (unused) or USER LEVEL LOCK.',

  `OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN` bigint(20) unsigned NOT NULL -- 'Address in memory of the instrumented object.',
  `LOCK_TYPE` varchar(32) NOT NULL -- 'Lock type. One of BACKUP_FTWRL1, BACKUP_START, BACKUP_TRANS_DML, EXCLUSIVE, INTENTION_EXCLUSIVE, SHARED, SHARED_HIGH_PRIO, SHARED_NO_READ_WRITE, SHARED_NO_WRITE, SHARED_READ, SHARED_UPGRADABLE or SHARED_WRITE.',
  `LOCK_DURATION` varchar(32) NOT NULL -- 'Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).',
  `LOCK_STATUS` varchar(32) NOT NULL -- 'Lock status. One of GRANTED, KILLED, PENDING, POST_RELEASE_NOTIFY, PRE_ACQUIRE_NOTIFY, TIMEOUT or VICTIM.',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event, as well as the line number where the instrumentation occurred. This allows one to examine the source code involved.',
  `OWNER_THREAD_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Thread that requested the lock.',
  `OWNER_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Event that requested the lock.'
) ;

  `END_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'NULL when the event starts, set to the thread''s current event number at the end of the event.',
  `EVENT_NAME` varchar(128) NOT NULL -- 'Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table',
  `SOURCE` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL -- 'Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.',
  `TIMER_START` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing started or NULL if timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_END` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds when the event timing ended, or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `TIMER_WAIT` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'Value in picoseconds of the event''s duration or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.',
  `WORK_COMPLETED` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of work units completed for the stage. NULL if the stage event progress is not instrumented.',
  `WORK_ESTIMATED` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'The number of work units expected for the stage. NULL if the stage event progress is not instrumented.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_ID` bigint(20) unsigned DEFAULT NULL -- 'EVENT_ID of event within which this event nests.',
  `NESTING_EVENT_TYPE` enum('TRANSACTION','STATEMENT','STAGE','WAIT') DEFAULT NULL -- 'Nesting event type. Either transaction, statement, stage or wait.'
) ;
events_stages_summary_by_user_by_event_n:
